meanings.definition: To apply for something in advance.
meanings.sent1: Students should preapply for scholarships to increase their chances of receiving financial aid.
meanings.sent2: It is a good idea to preapply for a job before it gets filled by someone else.
meanings.sent3: I preapplied for the cooking class, so now I just have to wait for the confirmation.
meanings.sent4: She decided to preapply for the leadership position to secure her place in the team.
meanings.sent5: Preapplying for the workshop saved me a spot among the first participants.

meanings.definition: To submit an application before the official deadline.
meanings.sent1: Make sure to preapply for the program to avoid any last-minute rush.
meanings.sent2: The students were advised to preapply for the internship to ensure their applications were reviewed on time.
meanings.sent3: I preapplied for the contest, hoping to impress the judges with my early submission.
meanings.sent4: By preapplying for the grant, she demonstrated her commitment to the project.
meanings.sent5: Preapplying for the scholarship gave me peace of mind knowing my application was already in.
